reviews.title: Disappointed the second time
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Aphrodite July 5-9 with a group of six women. We had two triple rooms. These were just OK. Although the Aphrodite had been remodeled recently, it appears that some upkeep is now necessary. Bathroom fixtures are in great need of repair/ replacement and the comforters on the beds and sofas need a good scrub. The air conditioning was almost Non-existant resulting in us having to open the window, letting in mosquitoes. Otherwise it is still very clean. The noise level can be an issue if you are a light sleeper. The staff is courteous and its location to Termini cannot be beat for the price. My husband and I stayed here in 2004 and it is on a downward turn as far as upkeep. I am having issues with charges pending on my debit card for one night for each room which should not be applied since I paid in cash upon checkout.

reviews.title: Some problems
reviews.text: Having prior expierenc with the proprietors of this hotel, I was looking forward to our stay. Initially I was not disappointed, as it was conveniently located near Termini, non-smoking, all of the fixtures and furniture were new, and the desk staff spoke good English and were helpful and efficient. However, an hour after our travel companions return to their room to change out of their WEDDING ATTIRE, our friends received a call from the front desk asking them to run the shower for five minutes so they could test a leak in the room below. The bride asked if they could wait, seeing that the couple was one hour post-wedding. Evidently it could not wait and our friends complied, and were shortly thereafter were shuffled off to an even smaller room. (Originally we weren't bothered with the shoebox sized rooms seeing that we have come to expect that in big cities.) The second room suffered from dripping condensation from the air vent and our friends listened to the drip, drip, drip, all night rather than be shuffled to a third room. The staff did, however, allow them a late checkout to compensation. Of course, they didn't adequately note that anywhere so we had to struggle with each change of shift to make them aware. So . . . while the initial appearance was good, I'd have to say the substance was a bit lacking.

We just returned from 2 nights here. First the good then the not so good.... close to Termini station (we arrived by train), close to Metro (easy to understand and great to use around Rome), breakfast was good, staff always nice and helpful, bathroom and room clean.
reviews.title: OK.....good location by train station
Good Value and Location
reviews.text: OK not so good...we requested a double room and got a room with 2 beds, so my husband and I had to sleep in seperate beds...not so great. Bathroom had a funky smell after flushing the toilet (sewage issues maybe???) room was warm, while at the reception area 2 different times guests were asking if someone could look into the ac...so I think that it's safe to say they have ac issues. Noise can be a little much but hey you are close to the train station so what can one expect.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel
reviews.text: I might stay here again depending on what other hotels have availability. this was last minute for us.

Stayed for 1 night in December,The rooms are small but clean & modern.There is a modern lift.Building is modern too.Must pay deposit for TV remote control????No English Channels,Breakfast terrible and Reception staff inexperienced!Credit card machine did not work on checkout resulting in me having to find cash and missing my train.(no discount!)Location is good near railway for those with train to catch.would not stay again.
reviews.title: Small rooms but clean
a pleasant stay
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at thr Hotel Aphrodite for two nights in October. The hotel itself is quite nice well maintained with a pleasant staff. The morning buffet is as so many have written just
adequate. The only negative is the location. We were disappointed that there was so little shopping in the area except for the shops in the train station
reviews.title: Very Convenient and Much Nicer Inside than Out

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Aphrodite last fall for three nights as did my parents and several other relatives. I had stayed once before at the suggestion of friends and will be going back again. It is by no means world class but inside it is more than clean. The rooms are small but modern and even have original artwork. It is very convenient to Termini Station and for a single traveller that is very nice -- you do not have to lug your suitcase far. If you are a walker you can easily walk to the Collusium or even the SPanish Steps. It is a long walk, but I even walked to the Vatican.
reviews.title: Just stay someplace else...
Avoidable hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast is basic but fine. The staff was always helpful with restaurant suggestions (not just tourist traps) and directions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a midweek break in Rome. When looking through the different websites for suitable accommodation I was disappointed to see that a lot of the affordable hotels in Rome seem to be quite shabby and old looking. Fortunately, we came across this small hotel next to the Termini Railway Station which claimed to have been recently renovated and judging from the pictures looked appealing.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite some of the previous reviews stating that the rooms could hardly fit a bed, we decided to give it a try and were pleasantly surprised at the condition and decor of the hotel in general. The room was a comfortable size for two people, and very bright, although the window had to be kept closed if you didn't want to hear the noise of the busy street.
reviews.title: Great Location, Small Room
Fantastic Small Hotel
reviews.text: The location is very practical as you can either walk to many of the sites, like the Colosseum, Fountain of Trevi, Spanish Steps etc (all about 15 min walk) or alternatively use the underground from the station or buses to all areas just in front of the station. The airport transfer bus run by Ryanair (Terravision) also stops right by the hotel (under 100 yards away). However, as many other areas next to stations, the streets nearby may seem a bit on the seedy side but otherwise safe as in Rome in general.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is served in a glazed sunroom at the top of the building and consists of tea/coffee, cereals, yoghurt, bread and spreads and a variety of pastries, which was adequate. The breakfast is served between 7.30am and 10am.
reviews.title: Two Star Only, Definitely Not Three Star

reviews.text: If I have to find something with room for improvement, it would probably be the size of the shower cubicles. Although just adequate for us, a large person would probably find it uncomfortable, as it was just about 2ft x 2ft (a bit on the tight side!).
reviews.title: Great!

likes.liked: — The newly renovated rooms and the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from Italy and stayed in this hotel at the beginning and the end of our 2 week stay. It definitely was a great location as it is very close to the Termini station and if you are planning on doing any travel by rail almost all of the destinations that you are going to will leave from this station. The first room we had had a really nice large bathroom with a jet tub (the jets didn't work) but it was still big compared to most European bathrooms!! The rooms were clean and because we were not facing the street it was quiet. They have a nice little terrace on the 5th floor that has a patio set and it is a nice place to sit and have a drink in the evening. I would also recommend the restaurant on the corner (I think it is called the Capitello) as it had excellent service , reasonable prices and good food compared to some of the other restaurants near the hotel. (It is just to the left on the corner as you exit the hotel) I would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Rome

reviews.text: We booked this hotel through a travel agent. After 15 hours of flight, we arrived at this place. Booking was confirmed way ahead of time, we presented the Voucher ticket, but the receptionist told us that our travel agent made a mistake by overbooking. We complained and requested that they confirmed with our travel agent, but all the talks lead to nowhere. Their only standard response was "Zis iz naut our fault. You can complain to your travel agent." The receptionist claimed this is not their fault and pushed us to another hotel (Scot House, which turned out to be an affiliate of Hotel Aphrodite and is rated 2 stars only.)
reviews.title: Hotel of Liars!!! Stay away!

likes.disliked: — There is no honesty. Disgraceful business practice. Poor receptionist.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After we returned home, we made a complaint to our travel agent, who in turned made inquiry to this situation. To my surprise, the travel agent said that the Hotel Aphrodite replied that during the date of our arrival, the room that was reserved for us had a broken door lock and so therefore it was not available. This is a total lie! The two ladies that we spoke with and wasted two hours there never said anything about a broken door lock! What a lie! I believe they oversold the rooms and tried to cheat us by giving us a less-expensive, affiliated(both hotel's front desks had broshures of each other), 2-star hotel!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our travel agent made apologies and was kind enough to refund us the money for the stay.
reviews.title: Excellent location, very clean, great breakfast

reviews.text: Shame on this hotel! Be ware and stay away!
reviews.title: Can be noisy!
